twstats 0.9.0

    • Examples of using twstats
    • Using twstats in a tutorweb question

    Using twstats in a tutorweb question

    2019-07-26

    tutorweb_question.Rmd

    Using twstats in a tutorweb question

    First, use twstats_find_tables to search for tables you can use:

    The following will search for any tables with year & value columns, and have roughly 10 rows in it.

    qn_tables <- twstats_find_tables('year/value', required_rowcount = 10)
head(qn_tables)
    ## [1] "eurostat/tps00070/country:DE" "eurostat/tps00070/country:CY"
## [3] "eurostat/tps00070/country:CZ" "eurostat/tps00070/country:DK"
## [5] "eurostat/tps00070/country:EE" "eurostat/tps00070/country:EL"

    Take this list and hard-code into the question code. Set TW:PERMUTATIONS to the length of this list. The resulting question code should look something like this:

    # TW:PERMUTATIONS=3

qn_tables <- c(
    'eurostat/tin00073/country:BE',
    'eurostat/tin00073/country:BG',
    'cbso/82610ENG/total')

question <- function(permutation, data_frames) {
    tbl <- twstats_get_table(qn_tables[[permutation]])
    d <- tbl$data()
    
    qtext = paste0(
        'The table below shows ', tbl$title, '.\n',
        'Find the difference of ', colnames(d)[[2]], ' between ', min(d$year), ' and ', max(d$year),"\n\n",
        paste(capture.output(print.data.frame(head(d))), collapse = "\n"))
    choices = c(
        d[d$year == max(d$year), 2] - d[d$year == min(d$year), 2],
        d[d$year == max(d$year), 2] - d[d$year == min(d$year), 2] - 10,
        (d[d$year == max(d$year), 2] - d[d$year == min(d$year), 2]) / 10)
    choicescorrect = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE)

    write_question(qtext = qtext, choices = choices, choicescorrect = choices_correct);
}

    This means that the output for each perumutation will be stable, e.g:

    cat(question(1))
    ## The table below shows Households with broadband access, Percentage of households, Belgium.
## Find the difference of Percentage of households between 2007 and 2018
## 
##   year Percentage of households
## 1 2007                       56
## 2 2008                       60
## 3 2009                       63
## 4 2010                       70
## 5 2011                       74
## 6 2012                       75
## 
## [ ] 28
## [ ] 18
## [ ] 2.8
    cat(question(3))
    ## The table below shows Total renewable energy production in the Netherlands.
## Find the difference of million kWh between 1990 and 2018
## 
##   year million kWh
## 1 1990         807
## 2 1991         935
## 3 1992         994
## 4 1993        1107
## 5 1994        1257
## 6 1995        1404
## 
## [ ] 17693
## [ ] 17683
## [ ] 1769.3

    Updating a question with new data

    To update a question, you need to preserve the order of existing tables in twstats_tables to ensure questions don’t change. Provide the existing list with previous_tables, which will filter then from the result:

    twstats_find_tables('year/value', required_rowcount = 10,
    previous_tables = qn_tables)
    ##   [1] "eurostat/tps00070/country:DE"              
##   [2] "eurostat/tps00070/country:CY"              
##   [3] "eurostat/tps00070/country:CZ"
